return_description: A Foundation object from the JSON data in data, or nil if an error occurs.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Foundation object from given JSON data.

return_description: A Foundation object from the JSON data in stream.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Foundation object from JSON data in a given stream.

return_description: JSON data for obj, or nil if an internal error occurs. The resulting data is encoded in UTF-8.

Methods.method_description: Returns JSON data from a Foundation object.

return_description: The number of bytes written to the stream, or 0 if an error occurs.

Methods.method_description: Writes a given JSON object to a stream.

return_description: true if obj can be converted to JSON data, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given object can be converted to JSON data.

class_description:
You use the JSONSerialization class to convert JSON to Foundation objects and convert Foundation objects to JSON.
A Foundation object that may be converted to JSON must have the following properties:
The top level object is an NSArray or NSDictionary.
All objects are instances of NSString, NSNumber, NSArray, NSDictionary, or NSNull.
All dictionary keys are instances of NSString.
Numbers are not NaN or infinity.
Other rules may apply. Calling isValidJSONObject(_:) or attempting a conversion are the definitive ways to tell if a given object can be converted to JSON data.
Thread Safety
On iOS 7 and later and macOS 10.9 and later JSONSerialization is thread safe.
